TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SerializerDescriptor extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides information about installed plug-in serializers.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Plug-in serializer classes derive from and implement the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.ISerializerFactory> interface.
## Examples The following examples illustrate using a SerializerDescriptor to return information on installed plug-in serializers.
[!code-cs[DocumentSerialize#DocSerializePlugIn](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/DocumentSerialize/ThumbViewer.cs#docserializeplugin)]
[!code-cs[DocumentSerialize#DocSerializeFileFilter](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/DocumentSerialize/ThumbViewer.cs#docserializefilefilter)]

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the assembly that contains the serializer.
Docs.value: The name of the assembly (usually a DLL) that contains the plug-in serializer.
Docs.returns: The name of the assembly (usually a DLL) that contains the plug-in serializer.

Docs.summary: Gets the path to the assembly file that contains the serializer.
Docs.value: The path to the assembly file that contains the plug-in serializer.
Docs.returns: The path to the assembly file that contains the plug-in serializer.

Docs.summary: Gets the version of the assembly that contains the serializer.
Docs.value: The version of the assembly that contains the plug-in serializer.
Docs.returns: The version of the assembly that contains the plug-in serializer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor CreateFromFactoryInstance(class System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.ISerializerFactory factoryInstance) cil managed

Docs.param: The source of data for the new .
Docs.summary: Creates a new through a given implementation.
Docs.returns: A new with its properties initialized with values from the given implementation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Only full trust callers can use this method.

Docs.exception: One or more of the following properties of the is null: <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.DisplayName%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.ManufacturerName%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.ManufacturerWebsite%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.DefaultFileExtension%2A>
Docs.value: A new with its properties initialized with values from the given implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets the default extension associated with files that the serializer outputs.
Docs.value: The default extension associated with files that the serializer outputs.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following examples illustrate using DefaultFileExtension to return the default file extensions for installed plug-in serializers.
[!code-cs[DocumentSerialize#DocSerializePlugIn](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/DocumentSerialize/ThumbViewer.cs#docserializeplugin)]
[!code-cs[DocumentSerialize#DocSerializeFileFilter](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/DocumentSerialize/ThumbViewer.cs#docserializefilefilter)]

Docs.returns: The default extension associated with files that the serializer outputs.

Docs.summary: Gets the public display name of the serializer.
Docs.value: The public display name of the serializer.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows using DisplayName to obtain and display the public name of a plug-in serializer.
[!code-cs[DocumentSerialize#DocSerializeFileFilter](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/DocumentSerialize/ThumbViewer.cs#docserializefilefilter)]

Docs.returns: The public display name of the serializer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to be compared with this .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Equals returns `true` even if the two objects differ in one or more of the following properties: <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.ManufacturerName%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.ManufacturerWebsite%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.IsLoadable%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the derived class that implements the serializer.
Docs.value: The name of the derived class that implements the serializer.
Docs.returns: The name of the derived class that implements the serializer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the unique hash code value of the serializer.
Docs.returns: The unique hash code value of the serializer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The unique hash code value is created based on the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.DisplayName%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.AssemblyName%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.AssemblyPath%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.AssemblyVersion%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.FactoryInterfaceName%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.WinFXVersion%2A> properties of the serializer.

Docs.value: The unique hash code value of the serializer.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the serializer can be loaded with the currently installed version of [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_avalonwinfx](../../add/includes/tlasharptla-avalonwinfx-md.md)].
Docs.value: if the serializer assembly can be loaded; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks IsLoadable should be **false** unless <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.AssemblyVersion%2A> has the same value as <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.WinFXVersion%2A>.
## Examples The following examples illustrate using IsLoadable to determine if the associated plug-in serializer can be loaded and used.
[!code-cs[DocumentSerialize#DocSerializeFileFilter](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/DocumentSerialize/ThumbViewer.cs#docserializefilefilter)]
[!code-cs[DocumentSerialize#DocSerializePlugIn](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/DocumentSerialize/ThumbViewer.cs#docserializeplugin)]

Docs.returns: if the serializer assembly can be loaded; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the company that developed the serializer.
Docs.value: The name of the company that developed the plug-in serializer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Plug-in serializer classes derive from and implement the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.ISerializerFactory> interface.

Docs.returns: The name of the company that developed the plug-in serializer.

Docs.summary: Gets the web address of the company that developed the serializer.
Docs.value: The web address of the company that developed the serializer.
Docs.returns: The web address of the company that developed the serializer.

Docs.summary: Gets the version of [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_avalonwinfx](../../add/includes/tlasharptla-avalonwinfx-md.md)] required by the serializer.
Docs.value: The version of [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_avalonwinfx](../../add/includes/tlasharptla-avalonwinfx-md.md)] required by the plug-in serializer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks WinFXVersion must have the same value as the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.AssemblyVersion%2A> or the serializer assembly cannot be loaded.

Docs.returns: The version of [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_avalonwinfx](../../add/includes/tlasharptla-avalonwinfx-md.md)] required by the plug-in serializer.
